title: Are Chinese, Korean, Vietnamese, and Japanese related to the Mongols given their facial appearances? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is quite weird for me to answer, because I don’t deal with genetics, but there is something that is quite interesting with much of Asia (Home of Mongoloids). While I can discern most Asian facial appearances from each other, the part that I find interesting is the Mongol Mark. Basically a mark on the babies of most Asians that is like a little bruised-looking area where a “tail” would be. Not meaning anything by calling it a tail, just giving a reference point. This “Mongol Mark” leads me to believe that they were/are related. As well, their migration patterns from Africa make them related. But then again, that makes us all related. We all came from the same place, not sure why everyone always wants to distinguish one from another.

Not that much. I guess you have just learned a new word: mongoloid. The term “mongoloid” means “of or relating to the broad division of humankind including the indigenous peoples of east Asia, SE Asia, and the arctic region of North America.” This humankind named so may simply because early Europeans know Mongols first and more than other races and anthologists keep this name. Anyway, Mongols were the first eastern Asian race that Europeans are widely known of.

Even I am related to Mongols. Probably. Genghis khan and his buds visited my neighborhood, pillaging and raping as they were going. Most East Asians and those on continental part of South East Asia are related to some degree, though Korea and Japan are more isolated and it is easier to tell them apart than e.g. a Chinese and a Thai person. For example, my girlfriend is a Thai scholarship student in England and many Chinese students assumed she was Chinese; they started to talk to her in Mandarin but of course she couldn’t understand. But, if you think all Asians look like the Mongols, then you’re probably not Asian, and you’re demonstrating the cross-race effect.

East Asians are Mongoloid by appearance and South-East Asians are southern-Mongoloid by appearance. It is probably why Japan wanted to unite all East and South-East Asia during the WWII by occupying them and creating a Great Asia.
